div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre:
481 Macedonia, 1962 Burial: c. 150 B.C. (T) Contents: 48 AR Lot A Philip V: 1 tetradr. ANS 1965.275.1 Perseus: 7 tetradr. ANS 1965.275.5 ANS 1965.275.6 ANS 1965.275.2 ANS 1965.275.4 ANS 1965.275.3 Macedonia, 1st Region: 7 tetradr. ANS 1965.275.7 ANS 1965.275.8 ANS 1965.275.9 ANS 1965.275.10 ANS 1965.275.11
Lysimachus: 2 late post. tetradr. (Byzantium ANS 1944.100.81557 ANS 1944.100.81518 ANS 1944.100.81530 ANS 1944.100.81531 ANS 1944.100.81556 ANS 0000.999.71333 ANS 1944.100.81525 ANS 1944.100.81527 ANS 1944.100.81533 ANS 1944.100.81554 ANS 1944.100.81548 ANS 1944.100.81491 ANS 1944.100.81555 ) Thasos: 1 spread-flan tetradr. ANS 1965.275.13
Athens: 18 New Style tetradr. ANS 1965.275.19 ANS 1965.275.20 ANS 1965.275.22 ANS 1965.275.24 ANS 1965.275.21 ANS 1965.275.27 ANS 1965.275.26 ANS 1965.275.14 ANS 1965.275.15 ANS 1965.275.25 ANS 1965.275.16 ANS 1965.275.23 ANS 1965.275.17 ANS 1965.275.18
Lot B Thasos: 1 spread-flan tetradr. Athens: 11 New Style tetradr. Disposition: New York 29 (of Lot A); Athens 6 (of Lot B) Varoucha, A Delt 1963, Chronika, p. 4, illus. (Lot B) Thompson, ANSMN 12 (1966), pp. 57-63, illus. (Lot A) Almost certainly two sections of a single hd. It is also possible, as Varoucha suggests, that the small finds of 1961- 1962 from Beroia (no. 479 above) and Kilkis (no. 480 above) belong to this hd.
